load more work our way. … They were saying that they wanted
work that was fast, good, and cheap. And if the work was
fast, good, and cheap enough, the reward would be the offer
of more work that is fast, good, and cheap. … Let me be
clear about this, these people are evil, and their work is
poison.
quotes.author: Hoss Gifford

quotes.quote:
Form follows function – that has been misunderstood. Form
and function should be one, joined in a spiritual union.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.quote:
There’s a subtle reason that programmers always want to
throw away the code and start over. The reason is that they
think the old code is a mess. […] The reason that they think
the old code is a mess is because of a cardinal, fundamental
law of programming: It’s harder to read code than to write
it.
quotes.author: Joel Spolsky

quotes.quote:
There are only two hard things in Computer Science: cache
invalidation and naming things.
quotes.author: Phil Karlton

quotes.quote:
Nothing is original. Steal from anywhere that resonates with
inspiration or fuels your imagination. Devour old films, new
films, music, books, paintings, photographs, poems, dreams,
random conversations, architecture, bridges, street signs,
trees, clouds, bodies of water, light and shadows. Select
only things to steal from that speak directly to your soul.
If you do this, your work (and theft) will be authentic.
Authenticity is invaluable; originality is nonexistent. And
don’t bother concealing your thievery – celebrate it if you
feel like it.
quotes.author: Jim Jarmusch

quotes.quote:
I find going to bed and pulling my imagination over my head
often means waking up with a solution to a design problem.
That state of limbo, the time between sleeping and waking,
seems to allow ideas to somehow outflank the sentinels of
common sense. That’s when they can float to the surface. I
find ideas often show up in the shower, or while I’m
contemplating marmalade and toast and breakfast.
quotes.author: Alan Fletcher

quotes.quote:
I love making the stuff, that’s sort of the core of it. I
love creating the stuff. It’s so satisfying to get from the
beginning to the end, from a shaky nothing idea to something
that’s well formed and the audience really likes. It’s like
a drug: You keep trying to do it again and again and again.
I’ve learned from experience that if you work harder at it,
and apply more energy and time to it, and more consistency,
you get a better result. It comes from the work.
quotes.author: Louis C.K.

quotes.quote: IF YOU MAKE EVERYTHING BOLD, NOTHING IS BOLD.
quotes.author: Art Webb

quotes.quote: Great design is eliminating all unnecessary details.
quotes.author: Minh D. Tran

quotes.quote:
If you are demanding registration before checkout, you need
to cease this practice immediately. It is costing you a
fortune.
quotes.author: Bruce Tognazzini

quotes.quote:
Babe Ruth was a Home Run king but he was also a strike out
king. Always go for the fences, even if it means some
designs strike out with clients. That’s the only way to hit
a home run.
quotes.author: Alex Zevallos

quotes.quote:
Easy is not to be underestimated. Easy taps the pool of
talent and ideas out there that were turned off by hard.
quotes.author: Chris Anderson

quotes.quote:
Inspired interiors indubitably involve ingenious imitations
of inspired interiors.
quotes.author: Ana Cummings

quotes.quote:
It’s not uncommon for designers to confuse a beautiful
looking product with one that works beautifully.
quotes.author: Braden Kowitz

quotes.quote: Worry is essentially a misuse of imagination.
quotes.author: Alex Osborn

quotes.quote:
The challenge is for the graphic designer to turn data into
information and information into messages of meaning.
quotes.author: Katherine McCoy

quotes.quote:
Design trends online change more often than the wind, and
slightly less often than my socks.
quotes.author: Suleiman Leadbitter

quotes.quote: Letterspacing creates speedbumps for the reader.
quotes.author: Michael Stinson

quotes.quote: What garlic is to food, insanity is to art.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote:
Most [clients] expect experience design to be a discrete
activity, solving all their problems with a single
functional specification or a single research study. It must
be an ongoing effort, a process of continually learning
about users, responding to their behaviors, and evolving the
product or service.
quotes.author: Dan Brown

quotes.quote:
It takes confidence to throw work away … When people first
start drawing, they’re often reluctant to redo parts that
aren’t right … they convince themselves that the drawing is
not that bad, really — in fact, maybe they meant it to look
that way.
quotes.author: Paul Graham

quotes.quote:
If you are going to have less things, they have to be great
things.
quotes.author: John Maeda

quotes.quote:
I can never stand still. I must explore and experiment. I am
never satisfied with my work. I resent the limitations of my
own imagination.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote:
Never let your clients see you drive a more expensive car
than they drive.
quotes.author: Rick Tharp

quotes.quote:
Limit your usage to two fonts (three at the absolute most)
to help viewers focus on the words, not how many different
fonts are saying them.
quotes.author: Dan Rubin

quotes.quote:
If you know how to use a pencil to draw, you could probably
draw anything. Now apply that to everything in life.
quotes.author: Justin Durban

quotes.quote:
All things are designed, just some things more thoughtfully
than others.
quotes.author: Arman Nobari

quotes.quote:
Design is the search for a magical balance between business
and art; art and craft; intuition and reason; concept and
detail; playfulness and formality; client and designer;
designer and printer; and printer and public.
quotes.author: Valerie Pettis

quotes.quote: Practicality is the serial killer of dreams.
quotes.author: Rasha Hamdan

quotes.quote:
I fill up a place, which may be better… when I have made it
empty.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
I have always railed against ideological purity, or any
other kind. Corruption is more interesting than purity.
quotes.author: Milton Glaser

quotes.quote:
It takes the same amount of effort to make bad art as to
make good art, and you won’t know which you’ve made until
you release it into the wild. You can continue to refine a
work until it doesn’t set off your own quality alarms, but
that’s no guarantee that what you’ve made will touch
anybody.
quotes.author: Nate Simpson

quotes.quote:
It’s very easy to be different, but very difficult to be
better.
quotes.author: Jonathan Ive

quotes.quote: A design is a designer’s mind in a suit.
quotes.author: Nasa Munir

quotes.quote:
It’s not about what you make, it’s about what you make them
feel.
quotes.author: Andrea Trew

quotes.quote:
I’m always surprised by the speed that people judge a site.
They’ve seen it for a few seconds, and already an opinion
has been formed. When I look at a design of a site, I don’t
immediately vent an opinion, but I take it all in slowly and
start to think of what could have been on the mind of the
designer.
quotes.author: Veerle Pieters

quotes.quote:
Testing one user early in the project is better than testing
fifty near the end.
quotes.author: Steve Krug

quotes.quote:
With type as with philosophy, music and food, it is better
to have a little of the best than to be swamped with the
derivative, the careless, the routine.
quotes.author: Robert Bringhurst

quotes.quote:
You can’t do better design with a computer, but you can
speed up your work enormously.
quotes.author: Wim Crouwel

quotes.quote:
If I do my job well, the identity program will also clean up
the image of the company, position it as being contemporary
and keep it from ever looking dated.
quotes.author: Saul Bass

quotes.quote: A brand is the promise of an experience.
quotes.author: Alexander Isley

quotes.quote:
I can think of nothing worse than becoming really popular,
being all the rage.
quotes.author: Rem Koolhaas

quotes.quote:
Imitation may be the “sincerest form of plagiarism,” but it
is also the mark of an inferior person.
quotes.author: David Ogilvy

quotes.quote:
We are interpreters – not merely translators between sender
and receiver. What we say and how we say it makes a
difference. If we want to speak to people, we need to know
their language. In order to design for understanding, we
need to understand design.
quotes.author: Erik Spiekermann

quotes.quote: Never let the blood show.
quotes.author: Charles Eames

quotes.quote:
Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too
heavy to be broken.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.quote:
It is far better to adapt the technology to the user than to
force the user to adapt to the technology.
quotes.author: Larry Marine

quotes.quote:
There’s a difference between making an imitation and selling
it.
quotes.author: Jonathan Hoefler

quotes.quote:
The typeface doesn’t really matter, as long as the text is
good.
quotes.author: John Maeda

quotes.quote:
Some people want their paychecks and to go home, and that’s
fine. You and me, though—we’re gonna work harder than they
do. We’ll build things that ensure that entire populations
just setting foot on the web for the first time can tap into
the collected knowledge of the whole of mankind.
quotes.author: Mat Marquis

quotes.quote:
Never fall in love with an idea. They’re whores. If the one
you’re with isn’t doing the job, there’s always, always,
always another.
quotes.author: Chip Kidd

quotes.quote:
Any attempt to separate design, to make it a
thing-by-itself, works counter to the inherent value of
design as the primary, underlying matrix of life.
quotes.author: Victor Papanek

quotes.quote:
Where do new ideas come from? The answer is simple:
differences. Creativity comes from unlikely juxtapositions.
quotes.author: Nicholas Negroponte

quotes.quote:
Stare. It is the way to educate your eye, and more. Stare,
pry, listen, eavesdrop. Die knowing something. You are not
here long.
quotes.author: Walker Evans
